text: Raema Lisa Rumbewas (10 September 1980 â€“ 14 January 2024) was an Indonesian weightlifter. She was the country's first athlete to have won medals in three Olympic Games. She competed in the women's 48 kg at the 2000 Summer Olympics and won silver with 185.0 kg in total. She won another silver medal at the 2004 Games. Rumbewas died on 14 January 2024 at the age of 43.Raema Lisa Rumbewas, the history-making lifter, passes away ==References== Category:1980 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Olympic silver medalists for Indonesia Category:Olympic bronze medalists Category:Weightlifters
title: Raema Lisa Rumbewas
